ElementsÔÉÅ

Elements are (mostly) objects that have a physical location within a PDF page.

Elements generally inherit from LayoutElement to provide a consistent interface for accessing location information.

  • LayoutElement

  • LayoutElementGroup

  • Aside

  • Bbox

  • DrawingElement

  • Font

  • ImageElement

  • LineElement

  • PageSection

  • Span

  • Table

  • TextBlock

  • TextList

LayoutElementÔÉÅ

class burdoc.elements.element.LayoutElement(bbox: Bbox, title: str = 'LayoutElement')ÔÉÅ

Base class for any layout object within the PDF. LayoutElements can be used to describe anything that has a bbox.

to_json(extras: Dict[str, Any] | None = None, include_bbox: bool = False) → Dict[str, Any]ÔÉÅ

Convert the object into a JSON object

Example JSON:

{
    "name": "LayoutElement",
    "bbox": {...} [optional]
}
Parameters:

  • extras (Optional[Dict[str, Any]], optional) ‚Äì Any additional items that should be included within the JSON. Defaults to None.

  • include_bbox (bool, optional) ‚Äì Include the bounding box. Defaults to False.

Returns:

A JSON representation of the object.

Return type:

Dict[str, Any]

LayoutElementGroupÔÉÅ

class burdoc.elements.element.LayoutElementGroup(bbox: Bbox | None = None, items: List[LayoutElement] | None = None, title: str = 'LayoutElementGroup')ÔÉÅ

Base class for any coherent group of layout objects within the PDF. The BBox of the LayoutElementGroup is the rectangle encompassing all Bboxes of it‚Äôs members.

append(item: LayoutElement, update_bbox: bool = True)ÔÉÅ

Add an item to the group

Parameters:

  • item (LayoutElement) ‚Äì Item to add

  • update_bbox (bool, optional) ‚Äì Should the group Bbox be recalculated or ignored? Useful when items are non-contigous (e.g. they cross columns or pages). Defaults to True.

merge(leg: LayoutElementGroup) → LayoutElementGroupÔÉÅ

In-place merge with another LayoutElementGroup

Parameters:

leg (LayoutElementGroup) ‚Äì LEG to merge with

Returns:

A reference to self

Return type:

LayoutElementGroup

remove(item: LayoutElement, update_bbox: bool = True)ÔÉÅ

Remove an item from the group

Parameters:

  • item (LayoutElement) ‚Äì Item to remove

  • update_bbox (bool, optional) ‚Äì Should the group Bbox be recalculated or ignored? Defaults to True.

Raises:

ValueError ‚Äì Item not present in list

to_json(extras: Dict[str, Any] | None = None, include_bbox: bool = False) → Dict[str, Any]ÔÉÅ

Creates JSON object from LayoutElementGroup

Example JSON:

{
    "name": "LayoutElementGroup",
    "bbox": {...} [optional]
    "items": [{...}]
}
Parameters:

  • extras (Optional[Dict[str, Any]], optional) ‚Äì Any additional items that need to be included in the JSON. Defaults to None.

  • include_bbox (bool, optional) ‚Äì Include the bounding box. Defaults to False.

Returns:

A JSON representation of the group

Return type:

Dict[str, Any]

AsideÔÉÅ

class burdoc.elements.aside.Aside(bbox: Bbox | None = None, items: List[LayoutElement] | None = None)ÔÉÅ

A small delimited section of text that is separate from the surrounding flow.

BboxÔÉÅ

class burdoc.elements.bbox.Bbox(x0: float, y0: float, x1: float, y1: float, page_width: float, page_height: float)ÔÉÅ

Utility class for storing and manipulating bounding boxes.

area() → floatÔÉÅ

Returns total area of bbox

Returns:

float

area_norm() → floatÔÉÅ

Returns total area of bbox as a percentage of the page area.

Returns:

float

center(norm: bool = False) → PointÔÉÅ

Returns a point representing the center of the bounding box.

Parameters:

  • norm (bool, optional) ‚Äì Return page-normalised co-ordinates.

  • False. (Defaults to) ‚Äì

Returns:

Point

clone() → BboxÔÉÅ

Returns a clone of the bounding box

Returns:

Bbox

static from_points(p1: Point, p2: Point, page_width: float, page_height: float) → BboxÔÉÅ

Create a Bbox spanning two points.

Parameters:

  • p1 (Point) ‚Äì Top-left corner

  • p2 (Point) ‚Äì Bottom-right corner

  • page_width (float) ‚Äì Width of page

  • page_height (float) ‚Äì Height of page

Returns:

Bbox

height(norm: bool = False) → floatÔÉÅ

Returns the height of the bounding box.

Parameters:

  • norm (bool, optional) ‚Äì Return page-normalised co-ordinates.

  • False. (Defaults to) ‚Äì

Returns:

float

is_vertical() → boolÔÉÅ

Test if the Bounding box is oriented vertically. I.e. that the height is greater than the width.

Returns:

_description_

Return type:

bool

static merge(bboxes: List[Bbox]) → BboxÔÉÅ

Merge several Bboxes into a single bbox spanning all of them

Parameters:

bboxes (List[Bbox]) ‚Äì

Raises:

ValueError ‚Äì No bboxes passed

Returns:

Bbox

overlap(other_bbox: Bbox, normalisation: str = '') → floatÔÉÅ

Calculates the overall overlap between this Bbox and another. Several normalisation options are provided:

‚Äú‚Äù: No normalisation ‚Äúfirst‚Äù: Return as percent of calling bounding box area ‚Äúsecond‚Äù: Return as percent of passed bounding box area ‚Äúmin‚Äù: Return as percent of smallest area ‚Äúmax‚Äù: Return as percent of largest area ‚Äúpage‚Äù: Return as percent of page area

Parameters:

  • other_bbox (Bbox) ‚Äì Passed bbox

  • normalisation (str, optional) ‚Äì Normalisation option. Defaults to ‚Äú‚Äù.

Returns:

float

to_json(include_page=False) → Dict[str, float]ÔÉÅ

Convert a Bbox to JSON format.

Example:

{
    'x0':float,
    'y0':float,
    'x1':float,
    'y1':float,
    'pw':float [optional],
    'ph':float [optional]
}
Parameters:

include_page (bool, optional) ‚Äì Include page width and height. Defaults to False.

Returns:

Dict[str, float]

to_rect() → List[float]ÔÉÅ

Returns a four point representation of the box.

Returns:

[x0, y0, x1, y1]

Return type:

List[float]

width(norm: bool = False) → floatÔÉÅ

Returns the width of the bounding box.

Parameters:

  • norm (bool, optional) ‚Äì Return page-normalised co-ordinates.

  • False. (Defaults to) ‚Äì

Returns:

float

x0_norm() → floatÔÉÅ

x0 normalised by its position on the page

Returns:

float

x1_norm() → floatÔÉÅ

x1 normalised by its position on the page

Returns:

float

x_distance(other_bbox: Bbox) → floatÔÉÅ

Returns the distance between called and passed Bbox in the x direction. Note that this is calculated centre to centre. It returns negatively if passed Bbox is below this Bbox.

Parameters:

other_bbox (Bbox) ‚Äì

Returns:

float

x_overlap(other_bbox: Bbox, normalisation: str = '') → floatÔÉÅ

Calculates the projected overlap between this Bbox and another in the x axis. Several normalisation options are provided:

‚Äú‚Äù: No normalisation ‚Äúfirst‚Äù: Return as percent of calling bounding box width ‚Äúsecond‚Äù: Return as percent of passed bounding box width ‚Äúmin‚Äù: Return as percent of thinnest box width ‚Äúmax‚Äù: Return as percent of widest box width ‚Äúpage‚Äù: Return as percent of page width

Parameters:

  • other_bbox (Bbox) ‚Äì Passed bbox

  • normalisation (str, optional) ‚Äì Normalisation option. Defaults to ‚Äú‚Äù.

Returns:

float

y0_norm() → floatÔÉÅ

y0 normalised by its position on the page

Returns:

float

y1_norm() → floatÔÉÅ

y1 normalised by its position on the page

Returns:

float

y_distance(other_bbox: Bbox) → floatÔÉÅ

Returns the distance between called and passed Bbox in the y direction. Note that this is calculated centre to centre. It returns negatively if passed Bbox is to the right of this Bbox.

Parameters:

other_bbox (Bbox) ‚Äì

Returns:

float

y_overlap(other_bbox: Bbox, normalisation: str = '') → floatÔÉÅ

Calculates the projected overlap between this Bbox and another in the y axis. Several normalisation options are provided:

‚Äú‚Äù: No normalisation ‚Äúfirst‚Äù: Return as percent of calling bounding box height ‚Äúsecond‚Äù: Return as percent of passed bounding box height ‚Äúmin‚Äù: Return as percent of shortest box height ‚Äúmax‚Äù: Return as percent of tallest box height ‚Äúpage‚Äù: Return as percent of page height

Parameters:

  • other_bbox (Bbox) ‚Äì Passed bbox

  • normalisation (str, optional) ‚Äì Normalisation option. Defaults to ‚Äú‚Äù.

Returns:

float

DrawingElementÔÉÅ

enum burdoc.elements.drawing.DrawingType(value)ÔÉÅ

Enumeration of types of drawing Burdoc understands.

  • LINE: Anything long and thin used as a visual separator

  • RECT: Usually means a square or outer edge defining an aside or section

  • BULLET: A small circle indicating a textual bullet point.

  • UNKNOWN: An unknown drawing type

Valid values are as follows:

LINE = <DrawingType.LINE: 1>ÔÉÅ
RECT = <DrawingType.RECT: 2>ÔÉÅ
BULLET = <DrawingType.BULLET: 3>ÔÉÅ
UNKNOWN = <DrawingType.UNKNOWN: 4>ÔÉÅ

ImageElementÔÉÅ

class burdoc.elements.image.ImageElement(bbox: Bbox, original_bbox: Bbox, image: int, properties: Dict[str, Any], image_type: ImageType = ImageType.UNKNOWN, inline: bool = False)ÔÉÅ

Core element representing an image with a page layout

__init__(bbox: Bbox, original_bbox: Bbox, image: int, properties: Dict[str, Any], image_type: ImageType = ImageType.UNKNOWN, inline: bool = False)ÔÉÅ

Create an image element.

Parameters:

  • bbox (Bbox) ‚Äì A Bbox representing the image‚Äôs visible extent

  • original_bbox (Bbox) ‚Äì A Bbox representing the image‚Äôs true extent

  • image (int) ‚Äì Index of page image store where image is found

  • properties (Dict[str, Any]) ‚Äì Any additional properties of the image

  • image_type (ImageType, optional) ‚Äì Purpose of the image. Default is UNKNOWN

  • inline (bool, optional) ‚Äì Whether the image layout should be inline or additional. Generally set later in processing. Defaults to False.

to_json(extras: Dict | None = None, include_bbox: bool = False, **kwargs)ÔÉÅ

    "name": "LayoutElement",
    "bbox": {...} [optional]
}

  • include_bbox (bool, optional) ‚Äì Include the bounding box. Defaults to False.

Returns:

A JSON representation of the object.

Return type:

Dict[str, Any]

enum burdoc.elements.image.ImageType(value)ÔÉÅ

Enumeration of types of images Burdoc understands.

  • INVISIBLE: Image isn‚Äôt visible on page

  • BACKGROUND: Image is used as background for the whole page

  • SECTION: Image is used as a background for a page section or aside

  • INLINE: Image is part of the flow of text (currently unused)

  • DECORATIVE: Image is a decorative element in the page layout but has no semantic meaning

  • PRIMARY: Image is a ‚Äòhero‚Äô image on the page

  • GRADIENT: Image is a smooth gradient used as a background

  • LINE: Image is used to semantically separate page sections

Valid values are as follows:

INVISIBLE = <ImageType.INVISIBLE: 1>ÔÉÅ
BACKGROUND = <ImageType.BACKGROUND: 2>ÔÉÅ
SECTION = <ImageType.SECTION: 3>ÔÉÅ
INLINE = <ImageType.INLINE: 4>ÔÉÅ
DECORATIVE = <ImageType.DECORATIVE: 5>ÔÉÅ
PRIMARY = <ImageType.PRIMARY: 6>ÔÉÅ
GRADIENT = <ImageType.GRADIENT: 7>ÔÉÅ
LINE = <ImageType.LINE: 8>ÔÉÅ
UNKNOWN = <ImageType.UNKNOWN: 9>ÔÉÅ

LineElementÔÉÅ

class burdoc.elements.line.LineElement(bbox: Bbox, spans: List[Span], rotation: Tuple[float, float])ÔÉÅ

Core element representing a line of text

__init__(bbox: Bbox, spans: List[Span], rotation: Tuple[float, float])ÔÉÅ

Creates a line element

Parameters:

  • bbox (Bbox) ‚Äì Bbox of the extent of the line

  • spans (List[Span]) ‚Äì List of text spans within the line, separation into spans implies a change in font.

  • rotation (List[float]) ‚Äì Degree of rotation from the x-axis

  • page_height (float) ‚Äì Used to normalise bbox

Returns:

LineElement

PageSectionÔÉÅ

class burdoc.elements.section.PageSection(bbox: Bbox | None = None, items: List[LayoutElement] | None = None, default: bool = False, backing_drawing: Any | None = None, backing_image: Any | None = None, inline: bool = False)ÔÉÅ

A fully contained section of the page on which layout analysis should be done independently.

__init__(bbox: Bbox | None = None, items: List[LayoutElement] | None = None, default: bool = False, backing_drawing: Any | None = None, backing_image: Any | None = None, inline: bool = False)ÔÉÅ

Create a PageSection. One of bbox or items must be provided

Parameters:

  • bbox (Optional[Bbox], optional) ‚Äì BBox of the section. Defaults to None.

  • items (Optional[List[LayoutElement]], optional) ‚Äì Items contained within the section. Defaults to None.

  • default (bool, optional) ‚Äì Is this part of the underlying page or a subsection. Defaults to False.

  • backing_drawing (Optional[Any], optional) ‚Äì Drawing used as the background for this section only. Defaults to None.

  • backing_image (Optional[Any], optional) ‚Äì Image used as the background for this section only. Defaults to None.

  • inline (bool, optional) ‚Äì Is this section inline with surrounding text. Usually inferred later in the pipeline. Defaults to False.

to_json(extras: Dict | None = None, include_bbox: bool = False, **kwargs)ÔÉÅ

}

  • extras (Optional[Dict[str, Any]], optional) ‚Äì Any additional items that need to be included in the JSON. Defaults to None.

  • include_bbox (bool, optional) ‚Äì Include the bounding box. Defaults to False.

Returns:

A JSON representation of the group

Return type:

Dict[str, Any]

TableÔÉÅ

class burdoc.elements.table.Table(bbox: Bbox, row_boxes: List[Tuple[TableParts, Bbox]], col_boxes: List[Tuple[TableParts, Bbox]])ÔÉÅ

Representation of a table within the text.

__init__(bbox: Bbox, row_boxes: List[Tuple[TableParts, Bbox]], col_boxes: List[Tuple[TableParts, Bbox]])ÔÉÅ

Creates a Table element

Parameters:

  • bbox (Bbox) ‚Äì Bounding box of the the table

  • row_boxes (List[Tuple[TableParts, Bbox]]) ‚Äì Bounding box and descriptor of each row - use TableParts.COLUMNHEADER to indicate a row used as a column header

  • col_boxes (List[Tuple[TableParts, Bbox]]) ‚Äì Bounding box and descriptor of each column - use TableParts.ROWHEADER to indicate a column used as a row header

enum burdoc.elements.table.TableParts(value)ÔÉÅ

Enum defining the different parts of a table that can be extracted

Valid values are as follows:

TABLE = <TableParts.TABLE: 0>ÔÉÅ
COLUMN = <TableParts.COLUMN: 1>ÔÉÅ
ROW = <TableParts.ROW: 2>ÔÉÅ
COLUMNHEADER = <TableParts.COLUMNHEADER: 3>ÔÉÅ
ROWHEADER = <TableParts.ROWHEADER: 4>ÔÉÅ
SPANNINGCELL = <TableParts.SPANNINGCELL: 5>ÔÉÅ

TextBlockÔÉÅ

class burdoc.elements.textblock.TextBlock(bbox: Bbox | None = None, items: List[LineElement] | None = None, text_type: TextBlockType = TextBlockType.PARAGRAPH)ÔÉÅ

Represents a standard grouping of lines into a paragraph. All text within a textblock can be considered to be of semantically equivalent fonts. This may include variations in bold or italics.

get_text() → strÔÉÅ

Returns all text contained within the block as a string This strips out any format or font information.

Returns:

str

to_json(extras: Dict[str, Any] | None = None, include_bbox: bool = False, **kwargs)ÔÉÅ

Convert the textblock into a JSON object

Parameters:

  • extras (Dict[str, Any], optional) ‚Äì Any additional fields that should be included. Defaults to None

  • include_bbox (bool, optional) ‚Äì Defaults to False.

  • **kwargs ‚Äì Arbitrary keyword arguments to be pass to superclass

Returns:

Dict[str, Any]

enum burdoc.elements.textblock.TextBlockType(value)ÔÉÅ

Possible types of text supported by the semantic classifier.

Valid values are as follows:

SMALL = <TextBlockType.SMALL: 1>ÔÉÅ
PARAGRAPH = <TextBlockType.PARAGRAPH: 2>ÔÉÅ
H1 = <TextBlockType.H1: 3>ÔÉÅ
H2 = <TextBlockType.H2: 4>ÔÉÅ
H3 = <TextBlockType.H3: 5>ÔÉÅ
H4 = <TextBlockType.H4: 6>ÔÉÅ
H5 = <TextBlockType.H5: 7>ÔÉÅ
EMPHASIS = <TextBlockType.EMPHASIS: 8>ÔÉÅ

An ordered or unordered list
